etymology.description: 燕(‘Yan’/northern) + 麦(‘grain’) = a northern grain → oats.
etymology.interpretation: A modifier–head compound where 麦 names the cereal class and 燕 likely points to the northern Yan region, marking it as a northern grain. Pattern parallels 大麦、荞麦, with 麦 as the head.
etymology.simplification: 麦 is the simplified form of 麥, reduced by removing inner strokes; adopted in 20th‑century script reform due to the high frequency of 麥-based graphs.

parts.english: swallow (bird); Yan (ancient northern state); northern; used in toponyms

examples.chinese: 我早餐常喝燕麦粥(我早餐常喝燕麥粥)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǎocān cháng hē yànmài zhōu.
examples.english: I often drink oatmeal porridge for breakfast.

examples.chinese: 燕麦含有丰富的膳食纤维(燕麥含有豐富的膳食纖維)。
examples.pinyin: Yànmài hányǒu fēngfù de shànshí xiānwéi.
examples.english: Oats are rich in dietary fiber.

examples.chinese: 北方地区广泛种植燕麦(北方地區廣泛種植燕麥)。
examples.english: Oats are widely cultivated in northern regions.
